It is made by cooking a custard mixture until set, then caramelizing the sugar topping under a broiler or in a bain-marie. It is typically cooked in a bain-marie and baked until set, then caramelized under a broiler or using a kitchen torch. It is cooked slowly in a bain-marie until the sugar forms a golden, crispy top. The dessert is often served with a fresh strawberry on top.	<>	Creme brulee is a dessert with a golden-brown caramelized sugar crust, creamy custard interior, and topped with a fresh strawberry.
